properties.value: Chickens are a type of domesticated bird kept as livestock by farmers, and are often found inside pens in the farms of Gielinor.

Chickens are a type of domesticated bird kept as livestock by farmers, and are often found inside pens in the farms of Gielinor.

Chickens are one of the weakest enemies in RuneScape, and are often killed by low-level players training their combat skills as they have very low defence and cannot deal damage to players: the chicken farms in Lumbridge are often crowded for this reason. Chickens will sometimes try to retreat when they have 1 hitpoint left.

Chickens count for bird Slayer tasks, which can be given by Turael.

Chickens are a source of several useful items, as when they are killed they drop raw chickens for Cooking, bones for Prayer, and 5 or 15 feathers for Fishing or Fletching. Feathers are usually in high demand, therefore killing chickens and selling their feathers can be somewhat profitable for low level players.

In most populated worlds, chicken coops are often full of bones, feathers, and raw chicken left by players training on the chickens. If one chooses to bury the bones and cook the chicken, they will be able to gain a small amount of Prayer and Cooking experience for free.

A variant type of chicken is attacked on Tutorial Island during the Magic tutorial.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

The average Chicken kill is worth 208.79.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • If a chicken is afflicted with poison or venom, instead of taking damage from the poison or venom, it will squawk, flap its wings, and lay an egg.[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 17 August 2018. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "If you poison a chicken, and let it continue attacking you without it dying, eventually it lays an egg."

'''Chickens''' are a type of domesticated [[Bird (disambiguation)|bird]] kept as livestock by [[farmer]]s, and are often found inside pens in the farms of [[Gielinor]].

Chickens are one of the weakest enemies in ''[[Old School RuneScape|RuneScape]]'', and are often killed by low-level players training their [[combat]] [[skills]] as they have very low [[defence]] and cannot deal damage to players: the chicken farms in [[Lumbridge]] are often crowded for this reason. Chickens will sometimes try to retreat when they have 1 hitpoint left.

Chickens count for bird [[Slayer]] [[Slayer task|tasks]], which can be given by [[Turael]].

Chickens are a source of several useful [[items]], as when they are killed they drop [[raw chicken]]s for [[Cooking]], [[bones]] for [[Prayer]], and 5 or 15 [[feather]]s for [[Fishing]] or [[Fletching]]. Feathers are usually in high demand, therefore killing chickens and selling their feathers can be somewhat profitable for low level players.

In most populated [[Server|worlds]], chicken coops are often full of bones, feathers, and raw chicken left by players training on the chickens. If one chooses to bury the bones and cook the chicken, they will be able to gain a small amount of Prayer and Cooking experience for free.

A variant type of [[Chicken (Tutorial Island)|chicken]] is attacked on [[Tutorial Island]] during the [[Magic]] tutorial.

==Trivia==
*If a chicken is afflicted with poison or venom, instead of taking damage from the poison or venom, it will squawk, flap its wings, and lay an egg.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1030534762983837697|date=17 August 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/VEggy|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=If you poison a chicken, and let it continue attacking you without it dying, eventually it lays an egg.}}
